original: Each Party shall provide reasonable assistance to the other party in protecting the Association Marks upon request. Each Party shall notify the other party immediately if it learns of any infringement of the Association Marks or Company.
ollama_generated:
Each Party is expected to offer such cooperation as is deemed practicable, though not necessarily extensive, in safeguarding the Association Marks at the request of the other party. In the event that a Party becomes aware of any potential misuse or infringement upon the Association Marks or Company, it shall promptly communicate this information to the other party without undue delay.

This revised clause softens the obligation slightly by changing "shall provide reasonable assistance" to "is expected to offer such cooperation as is deemed practicable," and it emphasizes immediate notification in case of infringement with the phrase "without undue delay."

original: 10.Mark.  The Party owning the infringed mark shall have sole discretion to determine whether to pursue such infringement.
ollama_generated: 10. Mark (Revised). In the event of an alleged infringement of the registered mark, the party bearing the infringed mark retains the exclusive right to instigate legal action; however, they shall provide written notice to the other party prior to taking any such action, allowing for a reasonable opportunity to remedy the alleged infringement.

original: 18.Non-Assignment:  This Agreement shall be between the Parties only, and does not grant rights to any other party. This Agreement may not be assigned by either Party without the prior written consent of the other Party. Any amendment of this Agreement must be in writing signed by authorized representatives of each of the Parties.
ollama_generated:
18. Assignability with Restrictions: This Agreement is initially binding solely upon the Parties, yet either Party reserves the right to assign its rights and obligations under this Agreement, provided that such assignment requires prior written consent from the non-assigning Party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed. Any amendment to this Agreement must be in writing, signed by duly authorized representatives of each Party, and shall only become effective upon mutual agreement between the Parties.

This revised clause allows for one party to assign their rights and obligations under the agreement, but they must obtain prior written consent from the other party. Additionally, any amendment to the agreement requires the signatures of authorized representatives of both parties, and is not effective until both parties agree to it. This slight change in wording shifts the initial non-assignability of the agreement to a conditional assignability, subject to the other party's consent.

original: 25.Compliance with Anti-discrimination Laws and Policies. Company states that it is its practice to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws relating to discrimination in the workplace and Company does not have any rule or policy that automatically excludes a person with diabetes from employment in any position with Company.
ollama_generated: 25. Adherence to Anti-discrimination Regulations and Principles: The Company acknowledges its commitment to complying with all relevant federal, state, and local regulations and internal policies prohibiting workplace discrimination. Notably, the Company reserves the right to accommodate individuals with diabetes in accordance with applicable laws, but may also consider an applicant's ability to perform job-related functions as a legitimate occupational qualification for certain positions.

original: Attn: Craig Holland, CEO 27.Governing Law:  This Agreement is subject to and shall be construed in accordance with the laws of the Commonwealth of Virginia with jurisdiction and venue in federal and Virginia courts in Alexandria and Arlington, Virginia. If any terms of this Agreement are invalid or unenforceable under any statute, regulation, ordinance, executive order or other rule or law, such term shall be deemed reformed or deleted only to the extent necessary to comply with such statute, regulation, ordinance order or rule, and the remaining provisions of this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect.
ollama_generated:
Attn: Craig Holland, CEO

27.Governing Law and Jurisdiction: This Agreement will be interpreted under the legal framework of Virginia, United States, with the option for either federal or state courts in Alexandria and Arlington, Virginia to handle any disputes that may arise. In the event that any provision of this Agreement is deemed invalid or unenforceable under any applicable statute, regulation, ordinance, executive order, or other legal instrument, such provision shall be modified to the minimum extent necessary for compliance, while all remaining provisions will retain their full validity and enforceability.

Shall Not Be Responsible For: Shall not be held liable for, unless expressly agreed otherwise in writing.

This change subtly shifts the responsibility from having an obligation to perform to not being held liable (responsible) unless there is a written agreement to the contrary.

original: Association Consumer E-News Company shall be recognized as a sponsor of National Get Fit Don’t Sit Day content featured in Consumer e-newsletters - Stop Diabetes®  and Living with Type 2 Diabetes Email Marketing Company shall be recognized as a national campaign sponsor in one (1) to two (2) email announcements, to the Association’s corporate lists and to our engaged consumer base. Corporate lists include current Association sponsors and wellness-minded companies who have engaged in past wellness day initiatives.
ollama_generated:
The National Get Fit Don't Sit Day, sponsored by Association Consumer E-News Company, shall be acknowledged as the featured content sponsor within Consumer e-newsletters - Stop Diabetes® and Living with Type 2 Diabetes Email Marketing Company. This acknowledgment will occur in two (2) to one (1) email announcements, which will be sent to both our engaged consumer base and the corporate lists of the Association. The corporate lists consist primarily of companies who have previously shown interest in wellness initiatives and are current sponsors of the Association.

In this revised version, the responsibility for sending more emails acknowledging the sponsorship has been shifted from the original parties to the Association Consumer E-News Company, and the number of email announcements has been reduced from a minimum of one to a maximum of two.

original: Social Media Association shall leverage its social media channels to engage participants in National Get Fit Don’t Sit Day:
ollama_generated: Participants are encouraged, though not obligated, to utilize the Social Media Association's social media platforms for engagement related to National Get Fit Don't Sit Day. The Social Media Association assumes no liability or responsibility for any participant's lack of engagement or participation in this event through its channels.

original: Description : Photo/graphic, headline, and 20-25 word blurb with link to Promotions That Give Back webpage.
ollama_generated: Description: Provision of an image or graphic, captivating headline, succinct caption (approximately 20-25 words), and inclusion of a hyperlink directing users towards the Promotions That Give Back webpage. It is optional for the service provider to create these elements, should they choose not to, we kindly ask that an appropriate substitute be provided in their stead.

original: A final schedule determining the dates and activities shall be mutually agreed to by the parties.
modified: The respective parties retain the discretion to independently set their own schedules regarding dates and activities, subject to mutual understanding and acceptance.
